p: Juglans regia, commonly known as the Persian Walnut, is a deciduous tree native to Asia and southeastern Europe. In Pakistan and India, the stems and bark have been used for teeth cleaning as chewing sticks [ 37, 43]. Five extracts of J. regia were examined in this study, with MIC and SI as follows: immature fruits ethanol extraction (MIC 64 μg/mL, SI >16), immature fruits methanol extraction (MIC 32 μg/mL, SI >32), woody parts ethanol extraction (MIC 32 μg/mL, SI >32), woody stems ethanol extraction (MIC 64 μg/mL, SI >16), and woody stems methanol extraction (MIC 64 μg/mL, SI >16).
